DataElement.preferredDefinition: The words by which the extent of a cancer in the body is known.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Quantification of disease extent in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to invasive cancer that is confined to the cervix; for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer confined to the corpus uteri with no or less than one-half myometrial invasion (IA) or invasion of one-half or more of the myometrium (IB).

Concepts.definition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to invasive cancer that is confined to the cervix; for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer confined to the corpus uteri with no or less than one-half myometrial invasion (IA) or invasion of one-half or more of the myometrium (IB).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to cancer that invades beyond the cervix, but not to the pelvic wall or lower third of the vagina; for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer that invades the stromal connective tissue of the cervix, but it does not extend beyond the uterus.

Concepts.definition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to cancer that invades beyond the cervix, but not to the pelvic wall or lower third of the vagina; for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer that invades the stromal connective tissue of the cervix, but it does not extend beyond the uterus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to cancer that extends to the pelvic wall, and/or involves the lower third of vagina, and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney; for endometrial cancer, FIGO stage III is subdivided into stages IIIA and IIIB; in FIGO stage IIIA, there is involvement of the serosa and/or the adnexa; for FIGO stage IIIB, there is vaginal or parametrial involvement.

Concepts.definition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to cancer that extends to the pelvic wall, and/or involves the lower third of vagina, and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney; for endometrial cancer, FIGO stage III is subdivided into stages IIIA and IIIB; in FIGO stage IIIA, there is involvement of the serosa and/or the adnexa; for FIGO stage IIIB, there is vaginal or parametrial involvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to cancer that invades the mucosa of bladder or rectum, and/or extends beyond the true pelvis (FIGO stage IVA), or to cancer with distant metastases (FIGO stage IVB); for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer that invades the bladder mucosa and/or the bowel mucosa (FIGO stage IVA), or to cancer with distant metastases (FIGO stage IVB).

Concepts.definition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to cancer that invades the mucosa of bladder or rectum, and/or extends beyond the true pelvis (FIGO stage IVA), or to cancer with distant metastases (FIGO stage IVB); for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer that invades the bladder mucosa and/or the bowel mucosa (FIGO stage IVA), or to cancer with distant metastases (FIGO stage IVB).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
